Sentencas: A detailed mathematical model that accounts for mass, momentum, heat, and electric charge transfer is developed for a tubular micro-solid oxide fuel cell.
Titulo: Modelling heat transfer for a tubular micro-solid oxide fuel cell with experimental validation

Sentencas: Electrochemical reactions as well as reversible and irreversible heat generation are modelled locally within the volume of each cermet electrode.
Titulo: Modelling heat transfer for a tubular micro-solid oxide fuel cell with experimental validation

Sentencas: The gas velocity profile and convective and conductive heat and mass transfer are modelled within each porous electrode and the gas channel.
Titulo: Modelling heat transfer for a tubular micro-solid oxide fuel cell with experimental validation

Sentencas: The heat transfer model includes the thermal radiation exchanged between surfaces.
Titulo: Modelling heat transfer for a tubular micro-solid oxide fuel cell with experimental validation

Sentencas: The simulation results are validated against electrochemical performance and temperature distribution experimental data.
Titulo: Modelling heat transfer for a tubular micro-solid oxide fuel cell with experimental validation

Sentencas: Simulation results are presented to give a detailed insight about several aspects of the cell's thermal behaviour.
Titulo: Modelling heat transfer for a tubular micro-solid oxide fuel cell with experimental validation

Sentencas: It is found that local heating within the electrodes is negligible when the temperature is controlled on the surface of the electrode.
Titulo: Modelling heat transfer for a tubular micro-solid oxide fuel cell with experimental validation

Sentencas: Temperature gradients along the cell's active length are found not to be negligible.
Titulo: Modelling heat transfer for a tubular micro-solid oxide fuel cell with experimental validation

Sentencas: Modelling heat transfer has a negligible effect on overall cell performance predictions for the specific setup of this study.
Titulo: Modelling heat transfer for a tubular micro-solid oxide fuel cell with experimental validation
